DataElement.preferredName: Specimen Related Genetic Research Consent Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator relating to consent and the related genetic research using a specimen.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to consent and the related genetic research using a specimen.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Specimen; a bit of tissue or blood or urine that is taken or used for research purposes.

Concepts.definition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Property.preferredDefinition: Related; connected or associated.:Having to do with information that is passed from parents to offspring through genes in sperm and egg cells; inherited.:Systematic investigation into a subject in order to discover facts, to establish or revise a theory, or to develop a plan of action based on the facts discovered.:Permission to do something.

Concepts.definition: A state of connectedness between people, objects, or events; to be associated or connected with something.
Having to do with information that is passed from parents to offspring through genes in sperm and egg cells.
Systematic investigation into a subject in order to discover facts, to establish or revise a theory, or to develop a plan of action based on the facts discovered.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: patients' acknowledgement and acceptance of participation in a clinical trial.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Patient's initial consent giv
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient's initial consent given for specimen use for genetic research relating to the study treatment

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has given permission to keep tissue sample(s) for use in genetic research

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the participant agree to participate in the pharmacogenetics study associated with this protocol

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: I agree that my specimens may be used for the genetic research studies (specimens for inherited research) specified in the protocol.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text  4
ReferenceDocuments.description: I agree that my blood may be used for the genetic research studies described in the protocol.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has given permission for Alliance to store and use his/her tissue sample(s) for use in genetic research

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has given permission to use his/her coded samples and related coded information to learn, prevent, find, or treat his/her type of cancer. This may also include research on inherited traits (genes passed on in families).

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: My coded samples and related coded information may be used to learn about, prevent, find or treat my type of cancer. This may also include research on inherited traits (genes passed on in families).

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG_CRF_Text_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was consent signed for pharmacogenetics studies

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: My specimen(s) may be used for the genetic research described in the protocol.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have you obtained the patient's consent for her blood to be kept for use in research about the correlation between genes and substances found in the blood and radiation side effects

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has given permission to give his/her tissue and blood sample(s) for research testing

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: My coded samples and related coded information may be used in the research described in the protocol to learn about, prevent, find or treat cancer.  This may also include research on inherited traits (genes passed on in families)

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has given permission to use his/her coded samples and related coded information to learn, prevent, find, or treat his/her type of cancer.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has given permission to store and use his/her tissue sample(s) to be used for future genetic research

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has given permission to give his/her (blood, tissue, etc.) sample(s) for research testing

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has given permission to use his/her coded samples and related coded information to learn about, prevent, find, or treat his/her type of cancer. This may also include research on inherited traits (genes passed on in families).

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient consented to Blood Genomics?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ECOG Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: I agree to participate in the genomic sequencing laboratory research study.

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient consent to allow blood, tumor, and urine tissue to be sent to a COG laboratory and studied to see if genetic changes can be used to predict how a subject will respond to therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient consent to complete surveys about how they feel physically and emotionally during and after cancer treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: DCP Question Text - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: My samples and related information may be kept in a Biobank for use in genetic research?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient agree to allow blood and tumor tissue to be sent to a COG laboratory and studied to see if genetic changes can be used to predict how a subject will respond to therapy?

DataElement.origin: CALGB CRF:Cancer and Leukemia Group B Case Report Form
DataElement.changeDescription: Replaced VD Patient Consent Ind-2 2018303v1.0 with VD ID#3506068 - Yes No Indicator - dbw
